info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:38PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN CIBOLA AND NORTHWESTERN VALENCIA COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM MDT... At 537 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles south of Mesita, or 20 miles south of Laguna Pueblo, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Cibola and northwestern Valencia Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.
